unified_fields.name: herb_id
unified_fields.description: Unique identifier for a TCM herb within the database
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Primary key for herb entity, format varies by database (e.g., HERB001234, H001, HERB001234, SMHB00001)

unified_fields.name: herb_name_chinese
unified_fields.description: Chinese character name of the herb
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Traditional Chinese name in Chinese characters

unified_fields.name: herb_name_pinyin
unified_fields.description: Romanized pronunciation of the herb name using Pinyin system
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Pinyin transliteration of Chinese herb name

unified_fields.name: herb_name_english
unified_fields.description: English common name of the herb

unified_fields.name: herb_name_latin
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Scientific taxonomic name following binomial nomenclature

unified_fields.name: tcm_nature
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Five-level thermal property classification according to TCM theory

unified_fields.name: tcm_flavor
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Taste properties according to TCM theory, multiple flavors possible

unified_fields.name: meridian_tropism
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Target organ systems according to TCM channel theory

unified_fields.name: compound_id
unified_fields.description: Unique identifier for a chemical compound/ingredient

unified_fields.name: compound_name
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Primary chemical name, may include IUPAC or common name

unified_fields.name: pubchem_cid
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Standardized compound identifier from NCBI PubChem database

unified_fields.name: smiles
unified_fields.description: Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry System notation
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Linear text representation of molecular structure

unified_fields.name: inchi_key
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Hashed version of InChI for compound lookup and deduplication

unified_fields.name: molecular_weight
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Sum of atomic weights of all atoms in the molecule

unified_fields.name: target_id
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Primary key for target entity, typically UniProt accession or gene symbol

unified_fields.name: gene_symbol
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Standardized human gene symbol from HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee

unified_fields.name: uniprot_id
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Universal Protein Resource accession for protein sequence identification

unified_fields.name: disease_id
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Disease identifier, typically MESH ID or internal ID

unified_fields.name: mesh_id
unified_fields.semantic_definition: NLM controlled vocabulary identifier for diseases

unified_fields.name: formula_id
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Primary key for formula entity representing multi-herb preparations

unified_fields.name: formula_name_chinese
unified_fields.description: Chinese character name of the formula
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Traditional Chinese formula name in characters

unified_fields.name: classical_source
unified_fields.description: Historical text reference for formula origin
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Reference to classical TCM literature where formula was first documented

unified_fields.name: herb_role
unified_fields.description: Role of herb in formula composition
unified_fields.tcm_term_chinese: Jun Chen Zuo Shi (君臣佐使)

unified_fields.name: source_herbs
unified_fields.description: Array of herb IDs that contain this compound
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Back-reference from compound to source herbs (many-to-many relationship)

unified_fields.name: predicted_targets
unified_fields.description: Array of computationally predicted target protein IDs
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Target proteins predicted through computational methods (not experimentally validated)

unified_fields.name: kegg_pathways
unified_fields.semantic_definition: KEGG pathway IDs and names associated with targets

HERB.name: geo_accession
HERB.semantic_definition: GEO series accession (GSE format) linking to expression experiments

HERB.name: expression_experiments
HERB.description: Array of GEO accession numbers for herb expression studies
HERB.semantic_definition: Links to transcriptomic experiments studying herb effects

HERB.name: connectivity_score
HERB.description: Signature connectivity score comparing herb to disease
HERB.semantic_definition: Score from -1 to +1 indicating expression pattern similarity or opposition

HERB.name: differential_genes
HERB.description: Up and down-regulated genes from treatment
HERB.semantic_definition: Gene lists significantly changed by herb treatment

HERB.name: fold_change_threshold
HERB.description: Minimum fold change for differential expression
HERB.semantic_definition: Cutoff value typically >= 2 for significant expression changes

ETCM.name: actions
ETCM.description: Therapeutic actions of herb according to TCM theory
ETCM.semantic_definition: Traditional therapeutic effects like 'tonifies qi', 'clears heat'

ETCM.name: indications
ETCM.semantic_definition: TCM pattern diagnoses and Western disease names

ETCM.name: therapeutic_category
ETCM.description: Classification of formula by therapeutic function

ETCM.name: herb_dosage
ETCM.description: Recommended dosage of herb in formula
ETCM.semantic_definition: Traditional weight measure for herb in formula preparation

TCMBank.name: chembl_id
TCMBank.semantic_definition: EBI ChEMBL database identifier for bioactivity data linkage

TCMBank.name: cas_number
TCMBank.semantic_definition: Unique chemical compound identifier assigned by CAS

TCMBank.name: logP
TCMBank.semantic_definition: Octanol-water partition coefficient indicating membrane permeability

TCMBank.name: tpsa
TCMBank.semantic_definition: Surface area contributed by polar atoms, predictor of absorption

TCMBank.name: hydrogen_bond_donors
TCMBank.description: Count of hydrogen bond donor atoms

TCMBank.name: hydrogen_bond_acceptors
TCMBank.description: Count of hydrogen bond acceptor atoms

TCMBank.name: rotatable_bonds
TCMBank.semantic_definition: Molecular flexibility indicator, <=10 for Veber rule

TCMBank.name: lipinski_violations
TCMBank.description: Number of Lipinski Rule of Five violations
TCMBank.semantic_definition: Count from 0-4, <=1 typically acceptable for oral drugs

TCMBank.name: pains_alerts
TCMBank.semantic_definition: Number of PAINS structural alerts flagging potential assay interference

TCMSID.name: ob
TCMSID.semantic_definition: Fraction of oral dose reaching systemic circulation (>=30% favorable)

TCMSID.name: dl
TCMSID.semantic_definition: Quantitative estimate of similarity to known drugs (>=0.18 drug-like)

TCMSID.name: bbb
TCMSID.semantic_definition: Predicted BBB penetration ability (>=-0.3 suggests penetration)

TCMSID.name: drug_like_compounds
TCMSID.description: Count of compounds passing OB>=30 and DL>=0.18 filters
TCMSID.semantic_definition: Number of ADME-filtered compounds for an herb

SymMap.name: symptom_id
SymMap.semantic_definition: SymMap internal ID for symptom entity (e.g., SMSY00001)

SymMap.name: symptom_name_chinese
SymMap.semantic_definition: Traditional symptom name in Chinese characters

SymMap.name: tcm_pattern
SymMap.semantic_definition: Traditional diagnostic pattern associated with symptom

SymMap.name: hpo_mappings
SymMap.description: Human Phenotype Ontology mappings for symptom
SymMap.semantic_definition: Cross-reference to standardized modern phenotype ontology

SymMap.name: symptom_herb_associations
SymMap.description: Herbs traditionally associated with treating this symptom
SymMap.semantic_definition: Many-to-many relationship between symptoms and herbs

SymMap.name: symptom_gene_associations
SymMap.description: Genes associated with this symptom via HPO mapping
SymMap.semantic_definition: Molecular basis of symptom through phenotype-gene linkage

SymMap.name: omim_id
SymMap.description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man identifier
SymMap.semantic_definition: OMIM disease/phenotype identifier for genetic linkage

BATMAN-TCM.name: tti_id
BATMAN-TCM.semantic_definition: Primary key for compound-target interaction record

BATMAN-TCM.name: interaction_type
BATMAN-TCM.description: Classification of interaction as known or predicted
BATMAN-TCM.semantic_definition: Indicates experimental validation status of interaction

BATMAN-TCM.name: confidence_score
BATMAN-TCM.semantic_definition: Score from 0-1 indicating reliability of predicted interaction

BATMAN-TCM.name: binding_data
BATMAN-TCM.semantic_definition: Experimental binding measurements from source databases

BATMAN-TCM.name: enrichment_ratio
BATMAN-TCM.semantic_definition: Ratio of observed to expected pathway hits

BATMAN-TCM.name: herb_processing
BATMAN-TCM.semantic_definition: Traditional processing techniques applied to raw herb

BATMAN-TCM.name: drugbank_id
BATMAN-TCM.semantic_definition: Cross-reference to DrugBank for approved drug compounds

unified_fields.name: smiles
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Linear text representation of molecular structure

unified_fields.name: traditional_system
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Traditional medical system using this plant

unified_fields.name: plant_part
unified_fields.description: Plant parts containing compound or used therapeutically

NPACT.name: activity_id
NPACT.semantic_definition: Primary key for activity data record

TM-MC.name: system_code
TM-MC.semantic_definition: Short code for traditional medicine system

TM-MC.name: local_name
TM-MC.description: Plant name in local language of traditional system

TM-MC.name: convergent_uses
TM-MC.description: Therapeutic uses shared across multiple systems

TM-MC.name: cross_system_validation
TM-MC.semantic_definition: Evidence of convergent use across traditions

IMPPAT.name: iupac_name
IMPPAT.semantic_definition: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry nomenclature

IMPPAT.name: deepsmiles
IMPPAT.semantic_definition: Extended SMILES format optimized for machine learning

IMPPAT.name: source_plant_parts
IMPPAT.description: Plant parts where compound was isolated

IMPPAT.name: hgnc_id
IMPPAT.semantic_definition: HGNC gene ID for target proteins

KampoDB.name: crude_name
KampoDB.semantic_definition: Common English name for raw material

KampoDB.name: protein_id
KampoDB.description: NCBI Gene ID for target protein

KampoDB.name: affinity_kcal_mol
KampoDB.semantic_definition: AutoDock Vina binding energy (more negative = stronger)

KampoDB.name: ligand_atoms
KampoDB.semantic_definition: Atom count for compound in docking

KampoDB.name: protein_atoms
KampoDB.description: Number of atoms in protein domain
KampoDB.semantic_definition: Atom count for protein domain in docking

unified_fields.name: organism_id
unified_fields.description: Unique identifier for biological organism/plant source

unified_fields.name: plant_part
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Standardized plant part terminology (radix, folium, flos, etc.)

NAPRALERT.name: geographic_distribution
NAPRALERT.semantic_definition: Regions where organism is naturally found

NAPRALERT.name: compound_class
NAPRALERT.semantic_definition: Natural product structural class (e.g., Diarylheptanoid, Alkaloid)

NAPRALERT.name: pubmed_id
NAPRALERT.semantic_definition: PMID for literature citation if available

NAPRALERT.name: data_types
NAPRALERT.description: Types of data in literature record

EMA Herbal.name: substance_id
EMA Herbal.semantic_definition: EMA internal identifier for herbal substance

EMA Herbal.name: latin_name
EMA Herbal.description: Botanical Latin name with plant part
EMA Herbal.semantic_definition: Binomial with standardized plant part suffix

EMA Herbal.name: drug_extract_ratio
EMA Herbal.semantic_definition: Ratio of plant material to extract (e.g., 4-7:1)

unified_fields.name: molecular_weight
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Sum of atomic weights in Daltons

HIT 2.0.name: experimental_method
HIT 2.0.description: Experimental method used to validate interaction
HIT 2.0.semantic_definition: Assay methodology (binding assay, enzyme inhibition, cell-based, etc.)

HIT 2.0.name: protein_class
HIT 2.0.semantic_definition: Classification such as Kinase, GPCR, Nuclear Receptor, Enzyme, Channel

HIT 2.0.name: validation_status
HIT 2.0.semantic_definition: HIT 2.0 only contains experimentally validated interactions

cross_subcategory_common_fields.description: PubChem Compound Identifier - universal compound cross-reference
cross_subcategory_common_fields.semantic_importance: Primary identifier for compound structure standardization across databases

cross_subcategory_common_fields.description: SMILES molecular notation - universal structure representation
HGNC gene symbol - standardized target identifier
cross_subcategory_common_fields.semantic_importance: Primary identifier for target protein gene

cross_subcategory_common_fields.description: UniProt protein accession - universal protein identifier
cross_subcategory_common_fields.semantic_importance: Cross-reference for protein sequence and annotation
Universal physical property for compound characterization

cross_subcategory_common_fields.description: Anatomical part of plant (root, leaf, bark, etc.)
cross_subcategory_common_fields.semantic_importance: Tissue-level localization of compounds and therapeutic uses

cross_subcategory_common_fields.description: Traditional medicine system (TCM, Ayurveda, Kampo, etc.)

herb_formula_relationship_fields.description: Many herbs contain many compounds; many compounds found in multiple herbs
Many compounds interact with many targets; many targets have multiple ligands
Formulas contain multiple herbs; herbs appear in multiple formulas
Symptoms treated by multiple herbs; herbs treat multiple symptoms
Symptoms associated with multiple genes via phenotype mapping

traditional_indication_fields.tcm_term: Jun Chen Zuo Shi (君臣佐使)

traditional_indication_fields.description: EMA regulatory classification (well-established vs traditional use)

compound_target_interaction_fields.description: Quantitative measure of compound-target interaction strength
Classification of interaction (known vs predicted, or functional type)
Prediction confidence or evidence quality score

metadata.extraction_methodology: Manual schema analysis from database documentation
notes: Fields marked 1:1 cardinality are single-valued; 1:N are multi-valued arrays
N:M relationships indicate many-to-many associations between entities
Semantic definitions capture the meaning and intended use of each field
Cross-references to PubChem, UniProt, KEGG enable multi-database integration
TCM-specific terminology includes Chinese terms (Pinyin) with definitions
ADMET/drug-likeness fields are computational predictions, not experimental
